item.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard Adds Free Mass Effect Items For N7 Day; Here's How To Unlock It
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dragon-age-the-veilguard-adds-free-mass-effect-items-for-n7-day-heres-how-to-unlock-it/1100-6527639/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Mass Effect fans know that November 7 has been designated by BioWare as N7 Day to celebrate the franchise. And while a new Mass Effect game is still likely years away, this year's N7 Day includes some Mass Effect content that you can find in BioWare's latest title, Dragon Age: The Veilguard.

There are three items that can be found, all of which reference Commander Shepard from the original Mass Effect trilogy:

  • Command Helmet
  • Paragon of Leadership
  • Specter of Battles Past

These N7 pieces are just cosmetic, so don't expect the armor to have any stats. The good news is that it's extremely easy to find this free content drop. After players finish The Singing Blade mission within the main quest, the Mass Effect armor will be waiting in a new chest located beside the Caretaker in the Lighthouse. If you've already beaten The Singing Blade and the chest isn't there, exit the game and make sure it's been updated. The chest should be there when you resume play.

Unfortunately for Dragon Age fans, BioWare recently confirmed that The Veilguard won't get any story expansion DLC because the team is now focused on the next Mass Effect game. But if the numerous create-a-character options in The Veilguard are any indication, Mass Effect's next title will give players even greater control over their character's appearance than before.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Call Of Duty's The Replacer Is Becoming A Playable Operator In Black Ops 6
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-dutys-the-replacer-is-becoming-a-playable-operator-in-black-ops-6/1100-6527638/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The centerpiece of Activision's Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 marketing campaign--Peter Stormare's The Replacer--is coming to the game as a playable character in the upcoming Season 1 update.

The Replacer tracer pack operator bundle comes with two skins for The Replacer, including a standard version and a bonus version for people who own the new Season 1 BlackCell bundle. The package also includes weapon blueprints for guns called Quick Wit and Ramifications, along with the "Aura +5000" animated calling card, the "Many Hats" animated emblem, the "Replacement Killer" finishing move, and a vehicular weapon charm.

For the BlackCell version of The Replacer, Activision warned that players need to buy the BlackCell bundle first; the skin won't work if you buy the BlackCell bundle after buying the Replacer bundle. Activision did not announce the price points for any of the new Season 01 store bundles.

Stormare himself voices The Replacer for this operator bundle.

Activision created more than two dozen Replacer ads for Black Ops 6, featuring Stormare replacing all manner of people, including TV hosts, the Pope, the NFL's Kyler Murray, boxer Canelo Alvarez, podcast host Joe Rogan, and political analysts. You can see all the spots on the Call of Duty YouTube page.

Stormare's The Replacer debuted in 2013 and has been a mainstay for Activision's Black Ops marketing campaigns over the years. The first in the series of commercials for Black Ops 6 featuring The Replacer went live during NFL matchups back in September.

“I’m your daddy now.” – The Replacer

There’s no substitute for greatness. The Replacer has concluded his whirlwind #BlackOps6 takeover tour and has freed up some time to appear in-game. Tracer Pack: The Replacer will be available shortly after Season 01 launch. pic.twitter.com/oXr2iXybSt

— Call of Duty (@CallofDuty) November 7, 2024

The Replacer has even replaced an in-game Call of Duty: Warzone character, Graves, prompting some to theorize Activision would eventually put him in the game--now that's happening. Activision said the Replacer bundle will be available "shortly" after Season 01 begins on November 14.

In addition to the Replacer bundle, players are getting new maps, modes, and weapons, along with a new Warzone map, Area 99. You can read Activision's extensive blog post to get up to date with everything coming in Season 01.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: 8BitDo's New Full-Sized Keyboards Are Up For Preorder
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/8bitdos-new-full-sized-keyboards-are-up-for-preorder/1100-6527630/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

8BitDo has released some great keyboards, but so far, they've all been tenkeyless (TKL) models that don't include a traditional numpad (although these are sold separately as add-ons). However, that's about to change as 8BitDo is finally launching full-size models of its Retro Keyboards based on its popular NES and Famicom-inspired designs. Priced at $120 each, they'll be available starting December 12.

8BitDo Full-Size Retro Mechanical Keyboards

$120 | Release December 12

While the design is inspired by console classics, the hardware itself is pretty modern. With these keyboards, you're getting a 108-key layout, V2 Kailh Box white switches, dye-sub PBT keycaps, hot-swappable PCB for easy key switch replacement, and support for N-key rollover. Like other 8BitDo products, these keyboards can also be heavily customized using the company's in-house Ultimate Software program, or if you're in a hurry, fast-mapping on programmable buttons won't require booting up the 8BitDo client.

These also support wireless connections via 2.4GHz and Bluetooth as well as wired via USB-C, and the included Super Buttons are a pair of big microswitch keys that can be customized to serve a wide selection of functions. The form factor on these keyboards are also very ergonomic, as the contoured design makes them feel great to work on. If they're anything like the smaller models, these will work great on not only Windows and Android devices, but also wirelessly on iOS, Mac, and Steam Deck.

More 8BitDo Keyboard Deals

Alternatively, you can grab the current TKL models as well, as these are available in a wider selection of retro-inspired designs. In addition to the NES and Famicom-influenced models, you can pick up keyboards sporting old IBM and Commodore 64 aesthetics. You can also pick up the 8BitDo N30 wireless mouse at a discounted price, as this is on sale for $19.80 (normally $30). While it has a barebones design, it includes a customizable D-Pad on the side--something you won't find on other wireless mice. Check out even more 8BitDo keyboard deals below.

8BitDo Mechanical Keyboards

  • 8BitDo C64 Edition Retro Mechanical Keyboard -- $90 ($110)
  • 8BitDo Fami Edition Retro Mechanical Keyboard -- $100
  • 8BitDo NES Edition Retro Mechanical Keyboard -- $90 ($100)
  • 8BitDo IBM Edition Retro Mechanical Keyboard -- $100

8BitDo Numpad Add-ons

  • 8BitDo C64 Mechanical Numpad -- $40.49 ($45)
  • 8BitDo Fami Mechanical Numpad -- $45
  • 8BitDo M Mechanical Numpad -- $45
  • 8BitDo NES Mechanical Numpad -- $41.39 ($45)

8BitDo's Wireless Mouse

  • 8BitDo Wireless N30 Mouse

item.title: GTA Online In November Is All About The Game's Best Feature
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gta-online-in-november-is-all-about-the-games-best-feature/1100-6527629/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Rockstar Games has announced what's next for Grand Theft Auto Online, and November's updates to the multiplayer game is all about what some believe be the game's best and most exciting feature: Heists.

Every week in November will focus on a different GTA Online Heist. This kicks off this week with the Cayo Perico Heist, with more to come throughout the month.

For anyone just catching up, GTA Online's heists call on players to take part in multi-mission campaigns with the aim of committing a high-profile crime with a lucrative payout.

The Cayo Perico heist, which was first released in 2020, has players trekking to the private island of Cayo Perico, fighting against armed guards, and getting away with all the money you can find. Players can take on heists solo or with friends, and coordinating with teammates makes it pretty thrilling.

November also brings a new Community Challenge, and this one is all about heists, naturally. Rockstar is calling on players to collectively steal $20 trillion worth of in-game cash between now and December 4, and if successful, Rockstar will give out "a vault full of rewards" to players.

Players who successfully complete the Cayo Perico heist between now and November 13 will earn the Panther Statue, with other rewards to be revealed later for completing more heists in November.

For more, be sure to read Rockstar's full blog post to get up to speed on everything new in GTA Online this week and beyond. In December, Rockstar Games has another major expansion coming and it's focused on robberies. After that, in 2025, Rockstar Games will bring PS5/Xbox Series X|S features to PC.

GTA Online launched in October 2013, which was a few weeks after the base game debuted in September of that year. The game has been steadily supported over the years and has a passionate fanbase. The game is "the gift that keeps on giving" for Take-Two, because it brings in so much money.

Many are wondering what's going to happen to GTA Online when GTA 6 launches in 2025, and that remains to be seen.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
